title: Improve MainMenu, add brightness control
body:
Improve MainMenu, add brightness control

Somehow it is not yet correctly persisted. I think I am loading globals incorrectly in main.cpp and that makes it reset this to the default value.
author: TokenRat

comments.body: Based on #24 , merge this one first.

Ok, there were more problems. A second `FSMGlobals` instance was created and the brightness was tried to be set before the values were read from the NVS. Now it should work and I did a super quick test on hardware.

Please test yourself and merge afterwards :heart:

title: Tweak a bunch of values
body:
Sorry for yet another mixed-bag PR, but the more I test around, the better values I find I think.

The 'longPress' can be verbalized/explained by 'hold the button and count to three' -> this naturally *almost* works. I decreased the delay from 2000ms to 1800ms, then it works nicely like this with natural counting speed. Also clear up some names.
author: TokenRat

comments.body: Added @DunkelRatte because he did the most extensive battery tests iirc
I just flashed it but it basically illuminates all LEDs in an RGB pattern for half a second or something. It is SUPER fast. Is this desired?

It is supposed to be a fast bootup animation. I tried different ways of improving it.

The idea is a 'Flash of energy' and then 'The dragon awakens'.

Let's merge. And if we know how to improve it, improve it! Feel free if you have alternative ideas. Not attached to it. Just better than 3s of black. :P

title: Add test GitHub workflow
body: This adds a test-workflow that tests compiling
author: TokenRat

comments.body:
I have a 'release' workflow as well. But I want to test it on a fork, which I can only do once the repo is public.

So adding the test workflow for now is nice.
Looks good. But do we want to run the CI job for all pushes on feature branches? Or do we want to limit it to `main`, `develop` and PRs?

main and PRs only. Which is 99% of all commits. But yes, let me sharpen the rules there.

But the only reason I see not to do this, is that it might eat EF's free runner minutes. But I just talked with Flam: They are hardly used and if it gets low, we will buy some more. So that is also fine.

As long as the cache works, I think we should use it.
One more question in our chat - than I will merge.
